solution_line_template: Each pot will have {num_creeping_jennies_per_pot} creeping jennies that cost ${cost_creeping_jenny_per_plant} each so that's {num_creeping_jennies_per_pot}*{cost_creeping_jenny_per_plant} = $<<{num_creeping_jennies_per_pot}*{cost_creeping_jenny_per_plant}={cost_creeping_jennies_per_pot}>>{cost_creeping_jennies_per_pot}

Each pot will have {num_geraniums_per_pot} geraniums that are ${cost_geranium_per_plant} each so that's {num_geraniums_per_pot}*{cost_geranium_per_plant} = $<<{num_geraniums_per_pot}*{cost_geranium_per_plant}={cost_geraniums_per_pot}>>{cost_geraniums_per_pot} each

The fern is ${cost_palm_fern_per_plant}, the creeping jennies are ${cost_creeping_jennies_per_pot} and the geraniums are ${cost_geraniums_per_pot} for a total of {cost_palm_fern_per_plant}+{cost_creeping_jennies_per_pot}+{cost_geraniums_per_pot} = $<<{cost_palm_fern_per_plant}+{cost_creeping_jennies_per_pot}+{cost_geraniums_per_pot}={total_cost_per_pot}>>{total_cost_per_pot} per pot

He wants a planter at each corner of his rectangle pool. A rectangle has {num_corners_rectangle} corners so he needs {num_corners_rectangle} pots at ${total_cost_per_pot} per pot for a total of {num_corners_rectangle}*{total_cost_per_pot} = $<<{num_corners_rectangle}*{total_cost_per_pot}={total_cost_all_pots}>>{total_cost_all_pots}
